title: How to Watch What We Do in the Shadows Season 6 – Air Dates and Streaming Status
description: Here's how to watch the sixth and final season of the cult-favorite vampire comedy What We Do in the Shadows.
author: Leanne Butkovic
excerpt: Here's how to watch the sixth and final season of the cult-favorite vampire comedy What We Do in the Shadows.
text: It's sadly time to say goodbye to one of the best comedies of the decade: What We Do in the Shadows is ending with its sixth and final season. Loosely based in the same universe as the 2014 New Zealand vampire mockumentary from Jemaine Clement and Taika Waititi, the FX series became a hit in its own right by following a few vampire roommates and their human familiar in Staten Island as they (barely) attempt to conquer all of New York Ci-tay.In IGN's 9/10 review of the series premiere back in 2019, Lauren Prudom wrote, "What We Do in the Shadows mines plenty of effective humor from the vampires’ discomfort with the human world, but much like the movie, the series really shines in the banter between the cast, and the surreal nature of their various supernatural abilities."Read on to find out how to watch the last season of What We Do in the Shadows online.How to Watch What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6The last season of What We Do in the Shadows starts October 21. New episodes air weekly on Monday nights at 10pm ET/PT on FX and stream on Hulu the next day. According to Variety, the entire season will eventually be streaming internationally on Disney+.Disney+, Hulu, Max BundleIncludes subscriptions to all three services with ads.In what is most likely not a coincidence, Disney+ and Hulu just increased their prices last week. If you're not already subscribed, it may be worth checking out their new streaming bundle package. What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 – Episode Release ScheduleThere are 11 episodes in the final season of What We Do in the Shadows – one more than the 10-episode run of every other season. The first three episodes aired last night and are now available to stream on Hulu. Here's the full season's release schedule:Episode 1: "The Return of Jerry" – airs October 21; streaming October 22Episode 2: "Headhunting" – airs October 21; streaming October 22Episode 3: "Sleep Hynosis" – airs October 21; streaming October 22Episode 4: "The Railroad" – airs October 28; streaming October 29Episode 5: "Nandor's Army" – airs November 4; streaming November 5Episode 6: "Laszlo's Father" – airs November 11; streaming November 12Episode 7: "March Madness" – airs November 18; steraming November 19Episode 8: "P.I. Undercover: New York" – airs November 25; streaming November 26Episode 9: TBA – airs December 2; streaming December 3Episode 10: TBA – airs December 9; streaming December 10Episode 11: TBA – airs December 16; streaming December 17How to Watch Seasons 1-5 of What We Do in the ShadowsAll previous seasons of What We Do in the Shadows are available to stream on Hulu and Disney+. The original What We Do in the Shadows movie is currently only available to stream with an Apple TV+ subscription, but it's available to rent or buy at Prime Video.The other What We Do in the Shadows movie spinoff, the Kiwi TV series Wellington Paranormal, has four seasons available to stream on Max.What Is What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 About?Here's the official Season 6 synopsis from FX:"After a very brief stint as a full-blown vampire, Guillermo is re-evaluating his life. Who is he if not a familiar who will do anything to please his Master in hopes of one day being turned into a vampire? Meanwhile, the vampires are re-evaluating, too. When their former roommate reappears after a 50-year nap, they realize how little they’ve done in half a century – not one goal accomplished, not one dream pursued, not one part of the New World conquered (except for their street and part of Ashley Street)."In the sixth and final season of the Emmy-nominated comedy, Nandor, Nadja, Laszlo, Colin, and Guillermo will enter the workforce, visit New Hampshire, go to a human dinner party, fête The Baron and conjure a demon – all while trying to find their place and their purpose in this crazy, mixed-up world."What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 Cast and CrewWhat We Do in the Shadows is executive produced by Jemaine Clement and Taika Waititi, as well as Paul Simms, Sam Johnson, Sarah Naftalis, Yana Gorskaya, Kyle Newacheck, Garrett Basch, and Eli Bush. It stars the following actors:Kayvan Novak as Nandor the RelentlessMatt Berry as Laszlo CravensworthNatasia Demetriou as NadjaHarvey Guillén as Guillermo de la CruzMark Proksch as Colin RobinsonKristen Schaal as The GuideDoug Jones as Baron AfanasAnthony Atamaniuk as Sean RinaldiMichael Patrick O’Brien as JerryGuest starring: Steve Coogan, Tim Heidecker, and moreOriginally posted: Oct 22, 2024 12:30 amIn This Article
html:
It's sadly time to say goodbye to one of the best comedies of the decade: What We Do in the Shadows is ending with its sixth and final season. Loosely based in the same universe as the 2014 New Zealand vampire mockumentary from Jemaine Clement and Taika Waititi, the FX series became a hit in its own right by following a few vampire roommates and their human familiar in Staten Island as they (barely) attempt to conquer all of New York Ci-tay.

In IGN's 9/10 review of the series premiere back in 2019, Lauren Prudom wrote, "What We Do in the Shadows mines plenty of effective humor from the vampires’ discomfort with the human world, but much like the movie, the series really shines in the banter between the cast, and the surreal nature of their various supernatural abilities."

Read on to find out how to watch the last season of What We Do in the Shadows online.

How to Watch What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6

The last season of What We Do in the Shadows starts October 21. New episodes air weekly on Monday nights at 10pm ET/PT on FX and stream on Hulu the next day. According to Variety, the entire season will eventually be streaming internationally on Disney+.

Disney+, Hulu, Max Bundle

Includes subscriptions to all three services with ads.

In what is most likely not a coincidence, Disney+ and Hulu just increased their prices last week. If you're not already subscribed, it may be worth checking out their new streaming bundle package.

What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 – Episode Release Schedule

There are 11 episodes in the final season of What We Do in the Shadows – one more than the 10-episode run of every other season. The first three episodes aired last night and are now available to stream on Hulu. Here's the full season's release schedule:

  • Episode 1: "The Return of Jerry" – airs October 21; streaming October 22
  • Episode 2: "Headhunting" – airs October 21; streaming October 22
  • Episode 3: "Sleep Hynosis" – airs October 21; streaming October 22
  • Episode 4: "The Railroad" – airs October 28; streaming October 29
  • Episode 5: "Nandor's Army" – airs November 4; streaming November 5
  • Episode 6: "Laszlo's Father" – airs November 11; streaming November 12
  • Episode 7: "March Madness" – airs November 18; steraming November 19
  • Episode 8: "P.I. Undercover: New York" – airs November 25; streaming November 26
  • Episode 9: TBA – airs December 2; streaming December 3
  • Episode 10: TBA – airs December 9; streaming December 10
  • Episode 11: TBA – airs December 16; streaming December 17

How to Watch Seasons 1-5 of What We Do in the Shadows

All previous seasons of What We Do in the Shadows are available to stream on Hulu and Disney+.

The original What We Do in the Shadows movie is currently only available to stream with an Apple TV+ subscription, but it's available to rent or buy at Prime Video.

The other What We Do in the Shadows movie spinoff, the Kiwi TV series Wellington Paranormal, has four seasons available to stream on Max.

What Is What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 About?

Here's the official Season 6 synopsis from FX:

"After a very brief stint as a full-blown vampire, Guillermo is re-evaluating his life. Who is he if not a familiar who will do anything to please his Master in hopes of one day being turned into a vampire? Meanwhile, the vampires are re-evaluating, too. When their former roommate reappears after a 50-year nap, they realize how little they’ve done in half a century – not one goal accomplished, not one dream pursued, not one part of the New World conquered (except for their street and part of Ashley Street).

"In the sixth and final season of the Emmy-nominated comedy, Nandor, Nadja, Laszlo, Colin, and Guillermo will enter the workforce, visit New Hampshire, go to a human dinner party, fête The Baron and conjure a demon – all while trying to find their place and their purpose in this crazy, mixed-up world."

What We Do in the Shadows: Season 6 Cast and Crew

What We Do in the Shadows is executive produced by Jemaine Clement and Taika Waititi, as well as Paul Simms, Sam Johnson, Sarah Naftalis, Yana Gorskaya, Kyle Newacheck, Garrett Basch, and Eli Bush. It stars the following actors:

  • Kayvan Novak as Nandor the Relentless
  • Matt Berry as Laszlo Cravensworth
  • Natasia Demetriou as Nadja
  • Harvey Guillén as Guillermo de la Cruz
  • Mark Proksch as Colin Robinson
  • Kristen Schaal as The Guide
  • Doug Jones as Baron Afanas
  • Anthony Atamaniuk as Sean Rinaldi
  • Michael Patrick O’Brien as Jerry
  • Guest starring: Steve Coogan, Tim Heidecker, and more

Originally posted: Oct 22, 2024 12:30 am
